subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Frank's Box on Paranormal State Tonight
author: juli velazquez
full_text:
--0-1195139997-1203363592=:56931
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=iso-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

Ok guys, take a breath!  He's got too much riding on this, its not live entertainment he will not let it the footage go South.  I myself and well as all of you will continue to move forward and that is all that matters.  We know in our hearts that our communication is real and no one will tell us different.  Let's let our friends on the otherside take care of this, for they know who is dedicated and sincere in the building, and researching end of things!  They haven't failed us now, and they will not let us down.
   
  Juli

Frank Ratka <warrior18eii@...> wrote:
              That would be interesting to know. Then again, I really don't wanna get wrapped up in Chris's little world. I don't know, it may turn out to be a blessing that Chris is made the inventor of "Frank's Box" if world wide exposure on TV goes bad.

Regards,

Frank R.

  ----- Original Message ----
From: "Marlboro63@..." <Marlboro63@...>
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Monday, February 18, 2008 1:23:57 PM
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Frank's Box on Paranormal State Tonight

    
  Should write A&E and ask them if Chris Moon is charging them $7.50 a minute to do his box session.  And explain is as that is what he charges the general public to do a box session.  Or rather 30 minutes is $250.00 and if you want to ask questions yourself then it is an additional $50.00.  Would be nice to see if he is doing it GRATTUS or he has made financial arrangements with them.  Just a thought.
   
  Jeff
   
    In a message dated 2/18/2008 1:18:49 P.M. Central Standard Time, warrior18eii@ yahoo.com writes:
          
    I don't know. I hope Chris wasn't stupid enough to claim it. I don't think so because he has displayed to us all that he knows what slander, liable, defamation and outright lying means. You wouldn't think that a network would be so careless but then again Paranormal State is lacking a lot in the research dept.

Don't get me wrong, it is entertaining. I can't stop laughing all the way through.

Regards,

Frank R.

  ----- Original Message ----
From: "Marlboro63@ aol.com" <Marlboro63@aol. com>
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
Sent: Monday, February 18, 2008 1:13:31 PM
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Frank's Box on Paranormal State Tonight

    
  Hi Frank,
   
  I just wonder where they got the idea that Chris Moon was the inventor?  They wouldn't of just "assumed" that considering it is named "Frank's Box"?
   
  Jeff
   
    In a message dated 2/18/2008 1:08:05 P.M. Central Standard Time, warrior18eii@ yahoo.com writes:
          
    I emailed Ryan that ya'll are trying to reach his producers. Maybe you will hear something back sooner.

Regards,

Frank R.

  ----- Original Message ----
From: "Marlboro63@ aol.com" <Marlboro63@aol. com>
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
Sent: Monday, February 18, 2008 12:55:11 PM
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Frank's Box on Paranormal State Tonight

    
  I emailed them and am hoping for a response back too.  But I doubt I will get it.
   
  Jeff
   
    In a message dated 2/18/2008 12:38:40 P.M. Central Standard Time, ghostchasingfool@ yahoo.com writes:
          
  That's ok Nellie, I will be setting the record straight pretty soon with the help of some dear friends.  
   
  Juli

purplespacefriend <purplealiengirl@ live.com> wrote:
      I e-mailed them--no response. I don't think they are all that 
concerned with facts.

Frank-S
--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com, rednellie <rednellie@. ..> wrote:
>
> I just ran across this episode description on A&E website:
> 
> "PRS explores the belly of the beast: a New York State Prison that 
was 
> once a mental asylum. Ryan and his team go behind bars to uncover 
the 
> institution' s paranormal past and present--current inmates and 
guards 
> are reporting mysterious new sightings! For their biggest case yet 
PRS 
> enlists the help of psychic Chip Coffey, demonologist Lorraine 
Warren 
> and Chris Moon, the owner/inventor of the latest in paranormal 
> technology, "Frank's Box," a radio designed to communicate with the 
dead"
> 
> I think they have their details a bit wrong. :-P
> 
> 
> Nellie
>
